io.smudgr.extensions.midi

Class MidiExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smudgr.extensions.midi.MidiExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControllerExtension, ReflectableType, Device.DeviceObserver

    public class MidiExtension
extends java.lang.Object
implements ControllerExtension, Device.DeviceObserver
    The MidiExtension provides functionality for binding Controllable items to an arbitrary MIDI controller input.

      • getTypeIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getTypeIdentifier()
        Description copied from interface: ReflectableType
        This should return a unique identifier of this type implementation.

        The name that this type implementation is identified to the user with may differ from this identifier. This concept is similar to a 'slug'.

        Implementations of a type should use this method to distinguish themselves.

        The String returned by this method should be changed between versions.

        Specified by:
        getTypeIdentifier in interface ReflectableType
        Returns:
        String that will enumerate this implementation across versions of the application
        See Also:
        ReflectableType.getTypeCategoryIdentifier(), ReflectableType.getTypeName()

      • bindDevice

        public void bindDevice(java.lang.String deviceName,
                       boolean startServer)
        Binds to a given device and optionally starts a DeviceServer to broadcast messages from the given device across the network.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - Fully-qualified device name that the system currently has the device registered to.
        startServer - optionally start a DeviceServer

      • waitForBind

        public void waitForBind(int control_id,
                        boolean absolute,
                        int ignoreKey)
        Waits and listens for the user to trigger an input, and binds that input to the given Controllable id
        Parameters:
        control_id - Project.getId(ProjectItem)
        absolute - true if the input should be an absolute value, such as a slider, or relative, such as a continuous knob
        ignoreKey - optional key to ignore accidental user input from
